results.title: Australian diary. No. 099
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Magazine items: At Broken Bay (N.S.W.), the Supervisor of Music, Dept. of Education conducts a camp to give music teachers practical training; poor hardwood country at Woolgoolga is being re-afforested with more valuable pines; a learn to swim campaign in Sydney teaches youngsters to take care of themselves in the water.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 098
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Magazine items: Trout fishing in Tasmania at Lake St. Clair and Penstock Lagoon; building the $22 million refinery at Altona, Victoria. (Shows the layout of a refinery , and ancillary services such as oil-tankers and harbour improvements).

results.title: Australian diary. No. 096
results.brief_description: Magazine items: Electronics control cement tile factory; fine turkeys are raised at a modern farm; shoe fashions down the ages are an interesting study; air hostesses who are also qualified pilots and navigators. No other credits availabe.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 095
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Big Eildon is the only item in this cinemagazine. It tells of the enlargement of the Eildon Reservoir, a 12 million pound project which put an earth mountain into the Goulburn River. The American Utah Construction Company joined with Australian, New Australian and overseas workers to create a lake larger than Sydney Harbour.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 094
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Bank machines give preview of automation - the Commonwealth Bank demonstrates electric typewriters and machines to count money, file and sort cheques. Olive growing as a new industry in Australia is shown along with the bottling and oil production at Robinvale. Radio controlled aircraft shows amazing development - a tour of the town of Woomera in South Australia and the Jindivik, pilotless target, being made and tested.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board

results.title: Australian diary. No. 093
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The following items are featured in this interesting cinemagazine: the paddle-steamer Coonawarra on the Murray River provides visitors with an opportunity to see the scenic wonder of the river; a N.S.W. family are skilled in hobbies and handicrafts making shell necklaces, souvenirs and dolls; huge tractors are built in Australian factory in Rydelmere, N.S.W. and these large earthmoving pieces of equipment are capable of carrying 20 tons at a speed of 30 m.p.h..
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board

results.title: Australian diary. No. 092
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The following items are featured in this interesting cinemagazine: Melbourne’s Royal Women’s Hospital provides mothers-to-be with all the facilities necessary for pre-natal and post-natal care; Newcastle’s State Dockyard is capable of building ships equal to the world’s best; Gundagai comes to life as the country town parades its pastoral wealth.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 091
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The aeroplane is playing an important part in the Australian economy by transporting perishable goods and general supplies across the vast distances of the continent; grasshoppers are fighting a losing battle against the modern insecticide and the aeroplane; swamplands surrounding Pedbank Weir are attracting migratory birds in their thousands.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 090
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Trainee air hostesses receive instruction in such subjects as care of children handling of emergency equipment; the arts of make-up and hairstyling; training of dogs to help police in the enforcement of law and order; how “Meals on Wheels”, a scheme founded and organized by Miss Doris Taylor, who was crippled, renders life easier for the aged and infirm.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board

results.title: Australian diary. No. 087
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The following items are featured in this interesting cinemagazine: at the Sydney Conservatorium of Music, a ballet, staged and created by a group of teenagers is performed and received enthusiastic praise from audiences; the making of whisky is shown requiring the skill of experts; hoops are used to provide children with a novel method of physical exercise.
